div.p: Outside a quiet town in Mexico called Sabinas, there's been an amazing discovery...
...the remains of a very large dinosaur.
"This is a very important thing, the dinosaur is around 50 feet long, 15 feet high, it might weigh between 3 and 4 tons."
Jose Gonzalez says that the discovery tells us that the land here, 75 million years ago, was a jungle.
Today it is a desert. How did the climate change? Scientists are seeking an answer to this mystery.
In Sabinas, the discovery of the huge dinosaur has created a lot of interest, especially among local children.
Some of them were looking for ancient tools used by hunters. Instead, they found dinosaur bones.
"I was with my dad. He was telling me a dinosaur had been found. We went over there and I found a piece of leg bone."
"When I come out here, I bring the things I need to dig. When I find something that looks like a fossil, I take it to someone so they can tell me if it's a fossil or not."
News of the dinosaur find has spread quickly. Dinosaur bones have now been found at 13 places.
And the news has extended to the rest of the world. International paleontologists have come here to examine the giant animal known as Sabinasaurio.
Juan Pablo Garcia, a local engineer, first found part of the ancient fossil when he was examining land for construction.
He says he was very lucky to find the pieces. He found a circular rock and some other bones, but he didn't know what they were.
Garcia had found pieces of the animal's back bone, a leg bone, and other smaller bones. Now, people are searching for the rest.
Scientists estimate this could be the most complete dinosaur skeleton ever found in Latin America.
"These right here are part of the ribs, these are the vertebras, ok? We're talking about this is the neck, the cervical vertebras."
"Right here you have the body of the animal, the back of the animal, we have around 52-53 vertebras total and right here starts the tail of the animal."
This isn't the first time fossils have been found here. But the appearance of these fossils means that Sabinas has become an important place for dinosaur hunters.
The mayor of Sabinas says that the fossils should be kept in a museum. In his opinion, people from all over Mexico - and abroad - should be able to study the area.
The town's residents feel good that the discovery happened in their town. The group of local people working on the find has grown to more than sixty members.
The mayor says that the discovery has been great for the town.
Local people say the dinosaur discovery has changed their city.
They hope that, in the future, more and more dinosaur lovers will visit their region of Mexico.
